0: 授業概要・カリキュラム上の位置づけ
1: The purpose of this course is to introduce students to the fundamentals of academic English writing using a process-oriented approach.  The structure of paragraphs and essays and ther important components are taught in small, learnable steps.  Clear, relevant models illustrate each step, and varied practices reinforce each lesson.  The models and practices feature current and general academic topics relevant to students' interests in a rapidly changing world.  The ideal student for this course would be one who has achieved an upper intermediate level of English competence and who enjoys writing and reading.  Please be aware that there is a substantial amount of in-class and out-of-class writing in this course.

This course will be conducted on an on-demand online basis.  Each week, an assignment package will be uploaded, and students will be required to complete the assignment and submit it online.  Students will have ample opportunity to have written communication with and get feedback from the instructor online.
Students will learn about fundamental academic writing from basic grammatical structures to the organization of paragraphs to develop a short essay.
